body.p:
Hon T. E. Bramblette
Governor of Ky-

The undersigned your petitioners citizens of Carroll County would respectfully state that at the aug term 1860 Allen T. Sha was tried in the Carroll Circuit Court and fined $50-for selling liquor to a minor. On the trial it was proved that the party to whom the liquor was sold had been trading for him self for 10 or 12 years and that he had the physical appearance of being over 21 -- Nor Sha We further state that Mr Sha is a man of moderate means that there has been no indictment found agst him since that time, that he has conducted himself as a law abiding citizen and we believe will continue to do so. Believeing that there was no intention to commit the offence and having full confidence in his future deportment. We respectfully request your excellency to remit the Comwths part of said fine.

Allen T. Shea.
H M Wise
S. Z. Roberts
W. C. Rutherford
W L Ringo
Robert Darling
R. Z. Jett
Henry Wetherill
R. S. Luckett
J. H Foster
G. W. Chapman
Benjamin Green
H W Darling
S. S. Carlisle
Thomas Wealch
Wm Darling
Prentis Meade
G. W Dunn
Geo Ringo Sir

I am well acquainted with the subscribers to this petition and Know that their signatures are genuine. They are men of veracity, influence and position. If consistent with executive policy the remission of this fine would be gratifying to This community

Carroll County
Sept 10th 1863
Application of Allan T. Sha for remission of fine Carroll Circuit.
Refused
Thos E. Bramlette
Entd on Ex Journal 10th Sept/ 63
